title: K-Star Data Engineer
content:
COMPANY OVERVIEW
KKR & Co. Inc., together with its subsidiaries, is a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management and capital markets and insurance solutions. KKR aims to generate attractive investment returns by following a patient and disciplined investment approach, employing world-class people, and supporting growth in its portfolio companies and communities. KKR sponsors investment funds that invest in private equity, credit and real assets and has strategic partners that manage hedge funds. KKRâ€™s insurance subsidiaries offer retirement, life and reinsurance products under the management of The Global Atlantic Financial Group. REAL ESTATE CREDIT OVERVIEW
KKR Real Estate Credit was formed in January 2015 to invest in real estate credit products and complement KKR Real Estateâ€™s private equity platforms. Within KKR Real Estate Credit, we seek opportunities where we have a sourcing, underwriting or execution advantage by leveraging KKRâ€™s brand, industry knowledge and relationships. KKR Real Estate Credit currently invests through six separately capitalized vehicles across our Direct Lending and Securities portfolios and consists of 50+ dedicated professionals based in New York, San Francisco, Houston and Dallas.
KKR is developing a dedicated services platform, named K-Star Asset Management (K-Star), to support asset management, loan origination, securities investing, risk management and client experience for its real estate credit franchise as it continues to scale. The team will include industry specialists to oversee special servicing, stabilized loan asset management, transitional loan asset management, and investment oversight across KKRâ€™s real estate credit portfolio. 
POSITION OVERVIEW
K-Star will develop an innovative, forward-thinking technology platform that will provide modernized solutions to change the landscape of the real estate servicing industry.  It will focus on building an intelligent, data-centric culture that requires a solid technological foundation where trusted and business-ready data is made available to the larger enterprise and leads to applying machine learning for automation of manual tasks. K-Star will curate a suite of PropTech systems to support the entire real estate ecosystem to include; onboarding, diligence, asset management, workout negotiation, financial analysis, modeling, reporting and covenant compliance, among many other servicing-related functions.
K-Star is seeking a Data Engineer to assist with defining the firmâ€™s enterprise data strategy and be responsible for designing, building, and operating data solutions that align with that strategy. 
We are looking for a dynamic, organized, customer-focused and data-centric individual who can work closely with business partners to drive the enterprise data strategy and develop, execute and continuously manage the implementation roadmap.  The ideal candidate is an individual that can pair their experience with managing and deploying data management tools. In the process the candidate will develop a deep understanding of the customer data and how it can best be leveraged to meet business objectives going beyond the technology elements to become true business partners.
Individual must be an exceptional communicator with a goal towards action, a creative problem solver, and have the ability to build strong partnerships across the various KKR businesses, including the Firmâ€™s leading technology and information systems team.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Work with data solutions architect to establish a data platform strategy.
Provide direct technical expertise in the design, development, implementation and testing of new platform.
Collaborate with team members to design, document and implement a data development life cycle to enforce consistency and uniformity of process.
Responsible for analyzing and understanding data sources, participating in requirement gathering, and providing insights and guidance on data technology and data modeling best practices.
Leverage knowledge of data models, data relationships, mapping lineage and business rules to ensure that solutions meet operational and business needs.
Implement and maintain data pipelines and data systems continuously improving the quality of deliverables.
Collaborate with business stakeholders and team members to identify automation opportunities.
QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelorâ€™s degree in business, computer science, software engineering, information systems, or a related field required. Advanced degree in business administration or information technology preferred.
5+ years combined experience: Analytics, Data Science, Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, Software Development, technical/engineering role(s) with a data focus (Internship experience does not apply).
3+ years of hands-on experience with AWS Services, AWS-native CI/CD tools.
3+ years of hands-on experience building automated ETL/ELT or data integration processes utilizing multiple source systems.
3+ years of hands-on experience with Python (data movement, ad-hoc analysis), PostgreSQL, and writing complex SQL queries and analysis of data correlations.
2+ years of experience with NoSQL implementation (Mongo, Cassandra).
2+ years of data warehousing experience (Redshift or Snowflake)
2+ years of experience with Agile engineering practices.
Hands-on experience in BI reporting (i.e. Power BI, Qlik, Tableau).
Experience in commercial real estate preferred.
Strong excel skills. Including ability to quickly get data into and out of multiple workbooks for ad-hoc business analysis.
Demonstrated integrity, independent thinking, judgment, and respect for others.
 
#LI-OnsiteKKR is an equal opportunity employer.  Individuals seeking employment are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, or any other category protected by applicable law.
